author: Brian Costa
title: How Team Canada Continues to Own the Podium at the Games
text:
GANGNEUNG, South Koreaâ€”In the years leading up to the 2010 Olympics in Vancouver, Canadian officials embarked on an ambitious plan. They wanted an impressive showing in the medal count, and they were willing to spend tens of millions of dollars more to get it.
The immediate result was typical for Olympic host countries, whose emphasis on their home Games often results in a spike in the medal count. Canada won 14 gold medals, a record high for a single country at the Winter Games. The strange thing is what happened after that.
